    "program_name": "BRAC Targeting the Ultra-poor Program (TUP)",

    "target_population": "Ultra-poor households, specifically the poorest of the poor"
  },

    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock (cows, bulls, goats, sheep)", "poultry", "tree nurseries", "village vending equipment (e.g., pushcarts)"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "A core activity of the program is to provide participants with a grant of specific physical assets. | 'The TUP program then provides assistance for using the transferred assets effectively as a microenterprise.'"

      "education"

    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "This paper uses a two-period panel data set (2002, 2005) to analyze the effects of the TUP program participation on a set of household outcomes including income, food security, clothing, health, child labor, schooling, and asset accumulation.",
    "study_design": "Non-experimental with matching estimators and heteroskedasticity-based identification",
    "design_evidence_citation": "To estimate the effects of TUP membership on household outcomes we take advantage of the recent heteroskedasticity-based identification approach due to Klein and Vella (2009). We also report estimates from two different matching estimators.",

    "program_name_citation": "BRAC implemented an ultra-poverty program called 'Challenging the Frontiers of Poverty Reduction: Targeting the Ultra-poor, Targeting Social Constraints' (henceforth TUP).",
    "country_citation": "BRAC implemented an ultra-poverty program called 'Challenging the Frontiers of Poverty Reduction: Targeting the Ultra-poor, Targeting Social Constraints' (henceforth TUP) in Bangladesh.",
    "target_population_citation": "The TUP program aims to improve the physical, human, and social capital of the poorest of the poor."
